author: data.always
content: Every time that the validator count ticks up enough to increase the churn limit, it seems to always takes 5 epochs for the activation count to increase to the new rate. Does anyone know why that is? i.e., yesterday at epoch 228,040 there were 786,438 active validators (65536 *12 + 6), but it wasn't until 228,045 that activations jumped to 12/block.

author: ralexstokes
content: there's some more rationale you can read here: https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/blob/master/phase0/beacon-chain.md#compute_activation_exit_epoch

author: data.always
content: so all activations and exits are delayed by 4 epochs to prevent strategic churning. that makes a lot of sense. tyty.
